quote: Instead getting notifications to update software, you receive notifications to suspend an update.
To unsubscribe from a newsletter there is no unsubscribe link. You need to create an e-mail filter rule.
To use a simple HR app, you need to start a virtual machine and boot into Windows.
A simple HR app crashes the only supported browser, the Internet Explorer every time when doing a common operation.
You are allowed to but cannot use Skype for technical reasons.
It takes days to resolve technical Skype issues.
You need to indicate your vacation in four different places.
You receive 100 e-mails per day and 99 of them have absolutely no relevance for you.
You receive an e-mail to download a license key from a Windows share for an internally purchased application.
You need to click “Edit” in order to reply to a ticket.
You need to decide using the corporate network or to do your actual job but you cannot do both.
You need to delete your browser cache and join a roll out session in order to use a marginally updated ticket system.
Your corporation thinks it needs to rebuild famous social networks with own tools, inside.
You have the choice between four differently configured networks to get your stuff done.
You get e-mail notifications for every spam e-mail that has been filtered.
The corporate network configuration screws up your network setup so badly that most of your apps are broken, even after you disconnect.
Even Microsoft Office is installed in a custom way, via a corporate installation wrapper.
You spend one hour to print a document because the printer is not accessible from your network.
You need to start another operating system in a virtual machine to print a document.
You switch between three different networks throughout the day by plugging in and out network cables.
My bank just asks for a 6 digit PIN — Dilbert Inc. asks for a generated 8 digit secondary password token.
You get an automated birthday congratulation from the CEO whom you have never met, ending with the company slogan.
You wait ten days for a delivery of a corporate mobile phone.
Navigating through the corporate page, you need to acknowledge a certificate pop-up window on every click.
You leverage MDD — Meeting Driven Development.
Software that takes 2 minutes to install from the Internet, takes 2 hours to install from the Corporate Intranet.
